text.p: Shareholders of Russian regional power utility Permenergo approved 1996 dividends of 8,460 roubles per preferred share at the annual meeting on Wednesday, company officials said.
They voted not to pay out a dividend for ordinary shares.
The meeting also approved issuing four bonus shares for every one share, raising company capital to 2.187 trillion roubles from 436 billion roubles.
For 1995 preferred dividends were 6,985 roubles, or 12.7 percent of the share's 55,000 rouble nominal. Ordinary dividends were 4,592.5 roubles, or 8.35 for shares of the same nominal value.

Permenergo, which covers the Perm area located in the Urals region of European Russia, had 1996 pretax profits of 869.47 billion roubles after 947.55 billion roubles in 1995, according to Russian accounting standards on an accruals basis.
One trade of Permenergo shares had been registered on the Russian Trading System on Thursday at $30.00, a rise from $29.00 at the close on Wednesday.
